meanings.definition: Put off (an action or event) to a later time; postpone.
meanings.sent1: I will defer my homework until tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She decided to defer her vacation until next month.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to defer gathering nuts for winter by taking a nap instead.
meanings.sent4: The flowers seemed to defer blooming until the sun shone brightly.
meanings.sent5: The student always defers studying until the night before the exam.

meanings.definition: Submit to the authority, direction, or judgment of another.
meanings.sent1: He chose to defer to his boss's decision on the project.
meanings.sent2: The team agreed to defer to the coach's strategy for the game.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to defer to the dog's wishes when it came to choosing a toy.
meanings.sent4: The river had to defer to the rocks in its path, changing course to flow around them.
meanings.sent5: The wise owl always defers to the advice of the older birds in the forest.
